title: High Risk of Impoverishing Expenditure for Surgical Care
description: In 2022, 100% of the population in Burundi was at risk of impoverishing expenditure for surgical care, indicating a significant financial burden on households.

title: Severe Stunting in Children Under 5
description: As of 2024, 52.8% of children under 5 in Burundi were affected by stunting, with 49.1% of females and 56.6% of males experiencing this condition, highlighting a critical public health issue.

title: High Female Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2023, 92.02% of female employment in Burundi was in agriculture, reflecting the sector's dominance in the labor market for women.

title: Predominance of Agriculture in Employment
description: By 2023, agriculture accounted for 85.05% of total employment in Burundi, with 77.60% of male employment in the sector, underscoring its central role in the economy.

title: Lowest Access to Clean Cooking Technologies
description: In 2022, only 0.1% of Burundi's population had access to clean fuels and technologies for cooking, highlighting a significant challenge in energy accessibility.

title: Minimal Internet Usage Among Females
description: As of 2017, only 1.49% of the female population in Burundi used the internet, indicating limited digital connectivity for women.

title: Low GDP Per Capita
description: In 2023, Burundi's GDP per capita was $193.01, one of the lowest globally, reflecting economic challenges.

title: Limited Access to Banking Services
description: In 2020, there were only 12.16 depositors per 1,000 adults in Burundi, indicating limited access to formal banking services.

title: Minimal Investment in Energy
description: In 2023, Burundi attracted only $1,000,000 in private energy investments, highlighting a need for increased financial inflows in the energy sector.

title: Low Educational Attainment Among Males
description: By 2017, only 22.69% of males aged 25 and above had completed primary education, underscoring educational challenges.

title: Minimal Specialist Surgical Workforce
description: In 2018, Burundi had only 0.4 specialist surgeons per 100,000 population, indicating a shortage in specialized medical professionals.

title: Low Employment in Industry
description: As of 2023, only 3.07% of Burundi's total employment was in the industrial sector, reflecting limited industrialization.

title: Low GNI Per Capita
description: In 2023, Burundi's GNI per capita was $220, one of the lowest globally, indicating economic constraints.

title: Low Employment in Services
description: In 2023, only 11.88% of Burundi's total employment was in the services sector, suggesting limited service industry development.
